meanings.def: an amount of a medicine or a drug that is taken once, or regularly over a period of time
examples: Repeat the dose after 12 hours if necessary.
Take a single dose at bedtime to help you sleep.
I always take my daily dose of vitamin C.
The nurse will administer the correct dose.
patients who receive high doses of this drug
A dose of flu kept me off work.
Workers at the nuclear plant were exposed to high doses of radiation.
I can cope with her in small doses (= for short amounts of time).
The film also contains a hefty dose of comedy.
He got through the housework like a dose of salts.

meanings.def: the same bad treatment that you have given to others
examples: Let the bully have a taste of his own medicine.
He got through the housework like a dose of salts.

idioms.idiom: a taste/dose of your own medicine
idioms.def: the same bad treatment that you have given to others
examples: Let the bully have a taste of his own medicine.

meanings.def: to give somebody/yourself a medicine or drug
examples: She dosed herself up with vitamin pills.
He was heavily dosed with painkillers.
